TopicTitle: Almaz to Mir: The Story of the Soviet Space Station Program

Articles.Content:
Ok, this is going to be the place, since I have decided to play around with Raidernick's stuff, that I will place stuff regarding the Soviet Space Program's space stations. I will be covering every space station they launched or built, excluding the ISS. For the time being, until I can figure out youtube, the posts will be in pictures and in downloadable footage that I take during my launches. Stuff to come

- - - Updated - - -

be aware that none of the altitudes to inclines are to scale or proper to what they really were

Edited October 3, 2015 by Sampa
On hold so raidernick can look into a bug I discovered

During the early 1960s, the Soviet Union began a long term recon space station program known as Almaz. This program's military nature was ended up being covered up as the first stations were known as the Salyuts. If the recon stations were launched and used for their purpose, they might have looked like this:
